Sección
BLOG INTERACTIVO: Inglés para personas con discapacidad auditiva

string.value: CSS class

unicode.value: El propósito fundamental de este blog interactivo, es generar un espacio de inclusión en cual tanto personas oyentes como no oyentes tengan a su alcance material didáctico para el aprendizaje del inglés. Así mismo, el presente espacio pretende crear una interacción genuina entre el aprendiz y el material,  de manera tal que pueda adaptarlo a sus condiciones particulares, de manera autónoma o por instrucción de su docente. Es importante recalcar que la transcripción fonética presente en esta página no se basa en el IPA (International Phonetic Alphabet); si bien, sirve como guía, la transcripción usada en el página es un equivalente fonético a la pronunciación, adquisición, y reconocimiento fonético de ciertos alumnos con discapacidad auditiva en el contexto Colombiano.

Text and Tasks
"Once I cut my toe"

string.value: CSS class

unicode.value:
It was back in 1999, a very sunny and beautiful day in Bucaramanga, Colombia, a young 5-year old boy whose main objective in life was playing soccer and riding bicycle. That day, I was playing soccer while my brother was riding his bicycle,so he invited me over:" Fabián, come here with me", I said yes. In that moment I thought that would be a cool idea, but suddenly it turned into the worst idea ever. When I put my foot on the wheel (barefoot to make it worse), he did not give a second to think but started to ride the bike instead. After that, all I remember is me calling  my mother´s name with the  most deafening voice ever, so she  went out right away and asked."What happened"; in shock, my brother just answered: "Nothing mom, we were just playing and riding the bike when the accident happened",.."What acciden" - she asked. My terrified brother answered, " Fabian cut his toe while riding the bicycle with me". Next, my mom called a taxi and ten minutes later I was at the hospital waiting to be assisted. The beautiful nurse washed my foot and took care of the situation.. I was shaking and crying, while my brother was talking to my mom trying to find a valid excuse for the situation.

it wos bak in naitín nairinain a verí sani dei in Bucaramanga, Colombia, a iong five-iar old boi jus mein objectif in laif wos pleing soker and raiding baicicol. Dad dei, ai wos pleing wail mai broder wos raiding jis baicicol, sou Ji invaired mi ouver: "Fabian, com jir wid mi", ai sed ies. In dad moment ai fot dad ai wud bi a kul aidea, bot sodenli it tornd intu de worst aidia ever. Uen ai put mai fut on the uil ()berfut tu meik it wors), ji did not gif m a second tu fink bot startid tu raid de baik insted. After dad, ol ai rimember is mi coling mai moder´s neim wid de most defenin vois ever, sou shi uent aut rait awei and askt: "uat japent"; in shok, mai broder yost anserd: "Nofin mom, wi wer yost pleing and raidin de baik uen di accident japent", "uat accident?" shi askt. Mai terrefaid broder anserd, "Fabian cot jis tou wail raidin de baicicol wid mi". Next, mai mom cold a taxi and ten minuts leirern ai was at de jospital weiting tu be asisted. De biutiful ners wosht mai fut and tuk ker of de situeishon. Ai wos sheikin and craiin, wail mai broder wos toking tu mai mom traiin tu fain a valid exkius for the situeishon.

Text and Tasks
PAST SIMPLE VS PROGRESSIVE

string.value: CSS class

unicode.value:
Past simple is mainly used to describe habits, routines and actions that were completed at a specific time in the past. We tend to use frequency adverbs, or specific times in the past.

* I had a quiz last night

* I always went to school at 6am

Past continuous is mainly used to describe an action happening at the moment, usually interrupted by another action.

* I was eating pizza when my mom called me.

* I was travelling to Barranquilla when my boyfriend had an accident.
Text and Tasks
University of Auckland

Although more often used in formal testing situations MCQs can be used as a testing tool to stimulate thought and discussion on topics students may feel a little reticent in responding to. When designing a MCQ test consider the following:
  • What learning outcomes are the questions testing
  • What intellectual skills are being tested
  • What are the language skills of the audience
  • Gender and cultural issues
  • Avoid grammar language and question structures that might provide clues

When building an MCQ consider the following:
  • Use phrases that learners are familiar with and have encountered in their study
  • Keep responses concise
  • There should be some consistency between the stem and the responses
  • Provide enough options to challenge learners to think about their response
  • Try to make sure that correct responses are not more detailed than the distractors
  • Distractors should be incorrect but plausible
Introduzca la pregunta. La pregunta debe ser clara y no ambigua. Evite las premisas negativas ya que estas tienden a confundir a los estudiantes.
